author: Ted Vollmuth, Phoenix Small Business Marketing Examiner
title: Have something good to market
text:
Allan Starr on good marketing. bing images 
Allan Starr of Marketing Partners, AZ ( www.marketingpartnersaz.com ) can always find a new twist to an old truism in marketing. In a recent newsletter article, Allan mimicked Mr. Obvious of television commercial fame when he wrote, “Good marketing depends on having something good to market.” 
Starr writes of recent experiences at Phoenix area golf courses where the service and product is much less than desirable. He finds this odd when fewer and fewer people are playing golf and many courses are either closing or suffering financially. 
He played a course where a bunch of young people were in a tournament related to the golf industry where they had each paid $35,000 for a course to help them in their careers. Noting how the industry is hurting Starr points out if you are paying top dollar for a golf experience the experience better be top notch. 
This of course is true of any business. People should get what they pay for which is usually great product and great service. “Spend good dollars on marketing and the customer experience had better be a good one,” Starr notes. 
The marketing expert says businesses must back up marketing dollars with good products and services. “Are your customers getting what they are seeking for their money?” asks Starr.
